DataElement.preferredName: Dominant Lymph Node Baseline Use Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the use of the dominant lymph node from baseline.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the use of the dominant lymph node from baseline.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Exercising influence or control.:A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Lymph glands filter lymph (lymphatic fluid), and they store lymphocytes (white blood cells). They are located along lymphatic vessels. Also called a lymph node.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Property.preferredDefinition: Baseline; an imaginary standard by which things are measured or compared.:Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: A starting point to which things may be compared.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
